m_szDocTitle: Inventiveness fills Union Station for annual Maker Faire | The Kansas City Star
m_szDocSumamry: June 27, 2015 3:48 PM Inventiveness fills Union Station for annual Maker Faire Brigid Reilly, 3, of Belton, reacted to the costume worn by James Bink from the movie "Predator," at the fifth annual Maker Faire at Union Station on Saturday. DAVID EULITT deulitt@kcstar.com Raymond Hadlock, left, holds a snake skin computer case, and Mark Tovar, owner of Eden Bio-Creations, holds a shedded snake skin at the Maker Faire Saturday in Kansas City. Tovar created a polymerizing process that preserves snake skins and crafts them into durable cell phone cases. Other uses are in the works. Karl Ramberg, 15
